article.headline: Santa Clara 87, Portland 77
article.story: SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) -- John Bryant had 15 points and 13 rebounds in leading Santa Clara to an 87-77 victory over Portland on Saturday night. Travis Niesen scored 19 points and 10 rebounds as the Broncos (8-5, 1-0 West Coast Conference) won third straight and fourth in five. Brody Angley added 17 points and Brandon Rohe had 14. Pooh Jeter scored a season-high 29 points to lead the Pilots (6-9, 0-1), who lost at Santa Clara for the 29th time in 35 games. Donald Wilson added 12 and Darren Cooper had 11. Portland played without its third-leading scorer and leading rebounder Marcus Lewis, who was serving a one-game suspension for violation of team rules. Lewis, who missed a team practice over the Christmas break, had a double-double in each of his last two games. Forward Chris Jackson, a junior out of Wollongong, Australia, made his first career start in Lewis' place. Santa Clara, the WCC's leading defensive team, allowed its second most points of the season and its most at home since losing to Gonzaga in last year's conference opener. It was also Portland's best offensive night on the road. The Pilots had averaged 56.6 points in six previous road games. A 13-0 run that bridged both halves put the Broncos ahead 45-36 early in the second. Santa Clara never lost the lead but could not shake the Pilots, who have won just once in seven road games. Jeter scored 17 of his team's 22 points during a 6:30 stretch that brought Portland within 73-69 with 3:47 remaining to play. Calvin Johnson hit a key 3-pointer with 2:01 left to put Santa Clara up 80-71 and the Broncos were able to hang on the rest of the way. Rohe, a 23 percent shooter entering the game, made four of his first six shots, including 3-of-4 from long range, for 11 first-half points. He had made just four of his previous 24 3-point attempts. The Broncos scored the last seven points of the first half to take a 39-36 lead into the locker room at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
